entries.name: digest(name, data)
entries.desc: Return the hash value computed with name Digest. name is either the long name or short name of a supported digest algorithm.

entries.name: new(string [, data]) → Digestclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a Digest instance based on string, which is either the ln (long name) or sn (short name) of a supported digest algorithm.

entries.name: block_length → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the block length of the digest algorithm, i.e. the length in bytes of an individual block. Most modern algorithms partition a message to be digested into a sequence of fix-sized blocks that are processed consecutively.

entries.name: digest_length → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the output size of the digest, i.e. the length in bytes of the final message digest result.

entries.name: name → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the sn of this Digest algorithm.

entries.name: reset → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Resets the Digest in the sense that any #update that has been performed is abandoned and the Digest is set to its initial state again.

entries.name: update(string) → aStringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Not every message digest can be computed in one single pass. If a message digest is to be computed from several subsequent sources, then each may be passed individually to the Digest instance.
